newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Riksbank reverse repo drains 64 bln skr.
newsitem.headline: Riksbank reverse repo drains 64 bln skr.

text.p: Sweden's central bank, the Riksbank, said on Tuesday it drained 64 billion crowns from the market in the morning's reverse repurchase operation set at a fixed rate of 5.25 percent.
The repo, which will run for seven days between September 4 and September 11, replaces a tender that drained 68 billion crowns from the market.
The central bank said 16.01 percent of the bids in the auction were allocated.
The repo rate, which is the central bank's key monetary policy tool, was last lowered on August 27 to 5.25 percent from 5.40 percent.
The deposit and lending rates, which form the floor and ceiling of the Riksbank's interest rate corridor, are currently set at 4.75 percent and 6.25 percent respectively.
